title: CString
table:
Compatibility with std::string Public



The type of object, charT, stored in the string.

no description

Reference to char.

no description




An unsigned integral type.


+ size_type: typedef Size;





no description




A signed integral type.


+ difference_type: typedef ssize_t;





no description




CString comparison Public



Compare two string like strcmp()


 + Compare: static int (const char*const s1, unsigned int l1, const char*const s2, unsigned int l2);






The comparison is done using unsigned characters.
return  An integer greater than, equal to, or less than 0, according as the string is greater than, equal to, or less than the given string






Compare two string like strcmp() (insensitive)


 + CompareInsensitive: static int (const char*const s1, unsigned int l1, const char*const s2, unsigned int l2);






The comparison is done using unsigned characters.
return  An integer greater than, equal to, or less than 0, according as the string is greater than, equal to, or less than the given string






Faster implementation of some commons routines Public



Upper case to lower case letter conversion (man 3 tolower)


 + ToLower: static int (int c);






no description

Constructors & Destructor Public



Default Constructor.


 + CString:  ();






no description




Copy constructor.


 + CString:  (const CString& rhs);






no description




Constructor from a mere CString .


 + CString:  (const char*const block, const Size blockSize);






no description




Constructor from a copy of a substring of 's'.



template<unsigned int SizeT, bool ExpT, bool ZeroT>
 + CString:  (const CString<SizeT, ExpT, ZeroT>& s, Size offset);






The substring is the portion of str that begins at the character position 'offset'.





Constructor from a copy of a substring of 's'.



template<unsigned int SizeT, bool ExpT, bool ZeroT>
 + CString:  (const CString<SizeT, ExpT, ZeroT>& s, Size offset, Size n);






The substring is the portion of str that begins at the character position 'offset' and takes up to 'n' characters (it takes less than n if the end of 's' is reached before).





Constructor from a copy of a substring of 's' (std::string)



template<class TraitsT , class AllocT >
 + CString:  (const std::basic_string< char, TraitsT, AllocT>& s, Size offset);






The substring is the portion of str that begins at the character position 'offset'.





Constructor from a copy of a substring of 's' (std::string)



template<class TraitsT , class AllocT >
 + CString:  (const std::basic_string< char, TraitsT, AllocT>& s, Size offset, Size n);






The substring is the portion of str that begins at the character position 'offset' and takes up to 'n' characters (it takes less than n if the end of 's' is reached before).





Constructor by copy from iterator.



template<class ModelT , bool ConstT, class ModelT2 , bool ConstT2>
 + CString:  (const IIterator<ModelT, ConstT>& begin, const IIterator<ModelT2, ConstT2>& end);






Parameters :
 begin An iterator pointing to the beginning of a sequence

 end An iterator pointing to the end of a sequence






Constructor by copy from iterator.

Parameters :
 begin An iterator pointing to the beginning of a sequence

 end An iterator pointing to the end of a sequence

 separator A string to add between each item






Constructor with a default value.

Append / Assign / Fill Public



Assign a new value to the string.



template<class U >
 + assign: void (const U& rhs);






Parameters :
 rhs Any supported value






Copy a raw C-String.



template<class StringT >
 + assign: void (const StringT& str, const Size size);






Parameters :
 cstr A C-String

 size Size of the given string






Copy a raw C-String.



template<class StringT >
 + assign: void (const StringT& str, const Size size, const Size offset);






Parameters :
 cstr A C-String

 size Size of the given string

 offset Offset of the first character to copy






Assign to the string all items within.



template<class ModelT , bool ConstT, class ModelT2 , bool ConstT2>
 + assign: void (const IIterator<ModelT, ConstT>& begin, const IIterator<ModelT2, ConstT2>& end);






The type held by the iterator can be anything as long as the type can be converted by the string (see specializations in the namespace `Yuni::Extension::CString`).

Parameters :
 begin An iterator pointing to the beginning of a sequence

 end An iterator pointing to the end of a sequence






Assign to the string all items within.



template<class ModelT , bool ConstT, class ModelT2 , bool ConstT2, class StringT >
 + assign: void (const IIterator<ModelT, ConstT>& begin, const IIterator<ModelT2, ConstT2>& end, const StringT& separator);






The type held by the iterator can be anything as long as the type can be converted by the string (see specializations in the namespace `Yuni::Extension::CString`).
  String  s  =  "string:  こんにちは" ;
  String::const_utf8iterator  a  =  s.utf8begin()  +  9;
  String::const_utf8iterator  a  =  s.utf8begin()  +  11;
  String  sub1(a,  b);
  std::cout  <<  sub1  <<  std::endl;  //  んに

  String  sub2;
  sub2.append(a,  b,  ",  " );
  std::cout  <<  sub2  <<  std::endl;  //  ん,  に



Parameters :
 begin An iterator pointing to the beginning of a sequence

 end An iterator pointing to the end of a sequence

 separator The string separator to use between each item






Assign to thestring all items within.



template<class ModelT , bool ConstT, class ModelT2 , bool ConstT2, class StringT , class EnclosureT >
 + assign: void (const IIterator<ModelT, ConstT>& begin, const IIterator<ModelT2, ConstT2>& end, const StringT& separator, const EnclosureT& enclosure);






The type held by the iterator can be anything as long as the type can be converted by the string (see specializations in the namespace `Yuni::Extension::CString`).
  String  s  =  "string:  こんにちは" ;
  String::const_utf8iterator  a  =  s.utf8begin()  +  9;
  String::const_utf8iterator  a  =  s.utf8begin()  +  11;
  String  sub1(a,  b);
  std::cout  <<  sub1  <<  std::endl;  //  んに

  String  sub2;
  sub2.append(a,  b,  ",  " );
  std::cout  <<  sub2  <<  std::endl;  //  ん,  に



Parameters :
 begin An iterator pointing to the beginning of a sequence

 end An iterator pointing to the end of a sequence

 separator The string separator to use between each item

 enclosure The enclosure string






Append to the end of the string a new value.



template<class U >
 + append: void (const U& rhs);






Parameters :
 rhs Any supported value






Append to the end of the string all items within.



template<class ModelT , bool ConstT, class ModelT2 , bool ConstT2>
 + append: void (const IIterator<ModelT, ConstT>& begin, const IIterator<ModelT2, ConstT2>& end);






The type held by the iterator can be anything as long as it can be converted by the string (see specializations in the namespace Yuni::Extension::CString ).

see :  namespace Yuni::Extension::CString

Parameters :
 begin An iterator pointing to the beginning of a sequence

 end An iterator pointing to the end of a sequence






Append to the end of the string all items within.



template<class ModelT , bool ConstT, class ModelT2 , bool ConstT2, class StringT >
 + append: void (const IIterator<ModelT, ConstT>& begin, const IIterator<ModelT2, ConstT2>& end, const StringT& separator);






The type held by the iterator can be anything as long as it can be converted by the string (see specializations in the namespace Yuni::Extension::CString ).
  String  s  =  "string:  こんにちは" ;
  String::const_utf8iterator  a  =  s.utf8begin()  +  9;
  String::const_utf8iterator  a  =  s.utf8begin()  +  11;
  String  sub1(a,  b);
  std::cout  <<  sub1  <<  std::endl;  //  んに

  String  sub2;
  sub2.append(a,  b,  ",  " );
  std::cout  <<  sub2  <<  std::endl;  //  ん,  に



see :  namespace Yuni::Extension::CString

Parameters :
 begin An iterator pointing to the beginning of a sequence

 end An iterator pointing to the end of a sequence

 separator The string separator to use between each item






Append to the end of the string all items within a range.



template<class ModelT , bool ConstT, class ModelT2 , bool ConstT2, class StringT , class EnclosureT >
 + append: void (const IIterator<ModelT, ConstT>& begin, const IIterator<ModelT2, ConstT2>& end, const StringT& separator, const EnclosureT& enclosure);






The type held by the iterator can be anything as long as it can be converted by the string (see specializations in the namespace Yuni::Extension::CString ).
  String  s  =  "string:  こんにちは" ;
  String::const_utf8iterator  a  =  s.utf8begin()  +  9;
  String::const_utf8iterator  a  =  s.utf8begin()  +  11;
  String  sub1(a,  b);
  std::cout  <<  sub1  <<  std::endl;  //  んに

  String  sub2;
  sub2.append(a,  b,  ",  " ,  '"' );
  std::cout  <<  sub2  <<  std::endl;  //  "ん",  "に"



see :  namespace Yuni::Extension::CString

Parameters :
 begin An iterator pointing to the beginning of a sequence

 end An iterator pointing to the end of a sequence

 separator The string separator to use between each item

 enclosure The enclosure string






Append to the end of the string a new value.



template<class StringT >
 + append: void (const StringT& s, const Size size);






Parameters :
 rhs Any supported value

 size Size of the container






Append to the end of the string a new value.



template<class StringT >
 + append: void (const StringT& s, const Size size, const Size offset);






Parameters :
 s Any supported value

 size Size of the container

 offset Offset of the first character to append







template<class U >
 + write: void (const U& cstr);







see :  template<class U> append(const U&, const Size)







template<class U >
 + write: void (const U& cstr, const Size size);







see :  template<class U> append(const U&, const Size)






Append a single signed char.


 + put: void (const char c);






no description




Append a single unsigned char.


 + put: void (const unsigned char c);






no description




Assign a new value to the string.



template<class U >
 + put: void (const U& rhs);






Parameters :
 rhs Any supported value






Insert a raw C-String at a given position in the string.


 + insert: bool (const Size offset, const char*const cstr, const Size size);






Parameters :
 offset Position of the first character in the string to be taken into consideration for possible matches. A value of 0 means that the entire string is considered

 cstr A C-String

 size Size of the string

return  True if the given string has been inserted, false otherwise (size == 0 or offset out of bounds)






Insert a single item at a given position in the string.


 + insert: bool (const Size offset, const char c);






Parameters :
 offset Position of the first character in the string to be taken into consideration for possible matches. A value of 0 means that the entire string is considered

 c A single item

return  True if the string has been inserted, false otherwise (size == 0 or offset out of bounds)






Insert an arbitrary C-String at a given position in the string.



template<class StringT >
 + insert: bool (const Size offset, const StringT& s);






Parameters :
 offset Position of the first character in the string to be taken into consideration for possible matches. A value of 0 means that the entire string is considered

 u Any CString container

return  True if the string has been inserted, false otherwise (size == 0 or offset out of bounds)






Insert an arbitrary C-String at a given position in the string.



template<class StringT >
 + insert: bool (const Size offset, const StringT& u, const Size size);






Parameters :
 offset Position of the first character in the string to be taken into consideration for possible matches. A value of 0 means that the entire string is considered

 s Any CString container

 size The size to use for the given container

return  True if the string has been inserted, false otherwise (size == 0 or offset out of bounds)






Insert any arbitrary string at a given offset provided by an iterator.



template<class ModelT , bool ConstT, class StringT >
 + insert: void (const IIterator<ModelT, ConstT>& it, const StringT& string);






If the offset is greater than the size of the string, the value will be merely appended to the string.





Insert a raw C-String at the beginning of in the string.


 + prepend: bool (const char*const cstr, const Size size);






Parameters :
 cstr A C-String

 size Size of the string

return  True if the given string has been inserted, false otherwise (size == 0 or offset out of bounds)






Insert a single item at the beginning of the string.


 + prepend: bool (const char c);






Parameters :
 c A single item

return  True if the string has been inserted, false otherwise (size == 0 or offset out of bounds)






Insert an arbitrary C-String at the beginning of the string.



template<class StringT >
 + prepend: bool (const StringT& s);






Parameters :
 u Any CString container

return  True if the string has been inserted, false otherwise (size == 0 or offset out of bounds)






Insert an arbitrary C-String at the beginning the string.



template<class StringT >
 + prepend: bool (const StringT& u, const Size size);






Parameters :
 s Any CString container

 size The size to use for the given container

return  True if the string has been inserted, false otherwise (size == 0 or offset out of bounds)






Overwrite a region of the string.



template<class StringT >
 + overwrite: void (const Size offset, const StringT& s);






The size of the string will remain untouched in any cases.

Parameters :
 offset Position of the first character of the region in the string

 s A CString






Overwrite a region of the string.



template<class StringT >
 + overwrite: void (const StringT& s);






The size of the string will remain untouched in any cases.

Parameters :
 s A CString






Overwrite a region of the string.


 + overwrite: void (const Size offset, const char*const cstr, const Size size);






The size of the string will remain untouched in any cases.

Parameters :
 offset Position of the first character of the region in the string

 cstr A C-String

 size Size of 'cstr'






Overwrite a region of the string from the right of the string.



template<class StringT >
 + overwriteRight: void (const StringT& s);






The size of the string will remain untouched in any cases.

Parameters :
 region A CString container






Overwrite a region of the string from the right of the string.



template<class StringT >
 + overwriteRight: void (const Size offset, const StringT& s);






The size of the string will remain untouched in any cases.

Parameters :
 offset Position of the first character (from the right) of the region in the string

 region A CString container






Overwrite a region of the string from the center of the string.



template<class StringT >
 + overwriteCenter: void (const StringT& s);






The size of the string will remain untouched in any cases.  String  s;
  s.resize(13,  '-' );
  s.overwriteCenter( "  Title  " );
  std::cout  <<  s  <<  std::endl;  //  '---  Title  ---'



Parameters :
 region A CString container






Fill the entire string with a given pattern.



template<class StringT >
 + fill: void (const StringT& pattern);






  String  s  =  "some  text  here" ;
  s.fill( '.' );
  std::cout  <<  s  <<  std::endl;  //  '..............'

  s.resize(20);
  s.fill( '.' );
  s.overwrite(0,   "Chapter  1  " );
  s.overwriteRight( "  4" );
  std::cout  <<  s  <<  std::endl;  //  'Chapter  1   .......  4'



Parameters :
 pattern The pattern






Fill the entire string with a given pattern from a given offset.



template<class StringT >
 + fill: void (Size offset, const StringT& pattern);






Parameters :
 offset Position of the first character where to start from

 pattern The pattern






Equivalent to append()

 + push_back: void (const U& u);






no description




Equivalent to prepend()

Find the offset of a sub-string from the left.


 + indexOf: Size (Size offset, const char cstr) const;






Parameters :
 offset Position of the first character in the string to be taken into consideration for possible matches. A value of 0 means that the entire string is considered

 cstr An arbitrary string character

return  The position of the first occurence found, `npos` if not found






Find the offset of a raw sub-string with a given length (in bytes) from the left.


 + indexOf: Size (Size offset, const char*const cstr, const Size len) const;






Parameters :
 offset Position of the first character in the string to be taken into consideration for possible matches. A value of 0 means that the entire string is considered

 cstr An arbitrary C-string

 len Size of the given string

return  The position of the first occurence found, `npos` if not found






Find the offset of any supported CString from the left.



template<class StringT >
 + indexOf: Size (Size offset, const StringT& s) const;






Parameters :
 offset Position of the first character in the string to be taken into consideration for possible matches. A value of 0 means that the entire string is considered

 cstr Any supported String

return  The position of the first occurence found, `npos` if not found






Searches the string for an individual character.


 + find_first_of: Size (char c, Size offset) const;






Parameters :
 offset Position of the first character in the string to be taken into consideration for possible matches. A value of 0 means that the entire string is considered.

return  The position of the first occurrence in the string (zero-based) npos if not found






Searches the string for an individual character (case insensitive)


 + ifind_first_of: Size (char c, Size offset) const;






Parameters :
 offset Position of the first character in the string to be taken into consideration for possible matches. A value of 0 means that the entire string is considered.

return  The position of the first occurrence in the string (zero-based) npos if not found






Searches the string for any of the characters that are part of `seq`.



template<class StringT >
 + find_first_of: Size (const StringT& seq, Size offset) const;






Parameters :
 seq An arbitrary string

 offset Position of the first character in the string to be taken into consideration for possible matches. A value of 0 means that the entire string is considered.

return  The position of the first occurrence in the string (zero-based) npos if not found






Searches the string for any of the characters that are part of `seq` (ignoring the case)



template<class StringT >
 + ifind_first_of: Size (const StringT& seq, Size offset) const;






Parameters :
 seq An arbitrary string

 offset Position of the first character in the string to be taken into consideration for possible matches. A value of 0 means that the entire string is considered.

return  The position of the first occurrence in the string (zero-based) npos if not found






Searches the string for the first character that is not `c`.


 + find_first_not_of: Size (char c, Size offset) const;






Parameters :
 seq An arbitrary string

 offset Position of the first character in the string to be taken into consideration for possible matches. A value of 0 means that the entire string is considered.

return  The position of the first occurrence in the string (zero-based) npos if not found






Searches the string for the first character that is not `c` (case insensitive)


 + ifind_first_not_of: Size (char c, Size offset) const;






Parameters :
 seq An arbitrary string

 offset Position of the first character in the string to be taken into consideration for possible matches. A value of 0 means that the entire string is considered.

return  The position of the first occurrence in the string (zero-based) npos if not found






Searches the string for any of the characters that are not part of `seq`.



template<class StringT >
 + find_first_not_of: Size (const StringT& seq, Size offset) const;






Parameters :
 seq An arbitrary string

 offset Position of the first character in the string to be taken into consideration for possible matches. A value of 0 means that the entire string is considered.

return  The position of the first occurrence in the string (zero-based) npos if not found






Searches the string for any of the characters that are not part of `seq` (case insensitive)



template<class StringT >
 + ifind_first_not_of: Size (const StringT& seq, Size offset) const;






Parameters :
 seq An arbitrary string

 offset Position of the first character in the string to be taken into consideration for possible matches. A value of 0 means that the entire string is considered.

return  The position of the first occurrence in the string (zero-based) npos if not found

This method is equivalent to the operator '=='

This method is equivalent to the operator '=='





Compare the string with another one.



template<class StringT >
 + compare: int (const StringT& rhs) const;






The comparison is done using unsigned characters.
return  An integer greater than, equal to, or less than 0, according as the string is greater than, equal to, or less than the given string






Compare the string with another one (ignoring the case)



template<class StringT >
 + compareInsensitive: int (const StringT& rhs) const;






The comparison is done using unsigned characters.
return  An integer greater than, equal to, or less than 0, according as the string is greater than, equal to, or less than the given string






Conversions Public



Convert the string into something else.



template<class U >
 + to: U () const;






The supported types (by default) are :
 std::string

 const char* (equivalent to `c_str()`)

 numeric (int, long, unsigned int, double...)

 bool






Convert the string into something else.



template<class U >
 + to: bool (U& out) const;






This method is strictly equivalent to `to()`, except that we know if the conversion succeeded or not.

Parameters :
 out The variable where to store the result of the conversion

return  True if the conversion succeeded. False otherwise






Iterating through the string Public



Get the next UTF-8 character.



template<bool InvalidateOffsetIfErrorT>
 + utf8next: UTF8::Error (Size& offset, UTF8::Char& out) const;






  String  t  =  "An  UTF8  string  :  こんにちは  !" ;
  std::cout  <<  "string             :  "  <<  t              <<  "\n" ;
  std::cout  <<  "valid              :  "  <<  t.utf8valid()  <<  "\n" ;
  std::cout  <<  "raw  size           :  "  <<  t.size()       <<  "\n" ;
  std::cout  <<  "nb  of  characters   :  "  <<  t.utf8size()   <<  "\n" ;

  //  Iterating  through  the  string
  String::Size  offset  =  0;
  UTF8::Char  c;
  std::cout  <<  "All  chars:  " ;
  do
  {
     if  (offset)
         std::cout  <<  ",  " ;
     if  ( UTF8::errNone  !=  t.utf8next< false >(offset,  c))
     {
         std::cout  <<  "<EOF>\n" ;
         break ;
     }

     std::cout  <<  c;
  }
  while  ( true );



Parameters :
 InvalidateOffsetIfErrorT True to automatically set the offset parameter to `(Size)-1` when the result is not `errNone`

Parameters :
 offset Offset in the string

 out The UTF-8 char

return  True if an UTF8 char has been found, false otherwise ( offset may become invalid)






Memory management Public



Get the item at a given position in a safe way.


 + at: int (const Size offset) const;






Contrary to the operator [], it is safe to use an invalid offset
return  The item at position offset , a default value if the offset is out of bound






Truncate the string to the given length.


 + truncate: void (const Size newSize);






Nothing will be done if the new size if greater than the current one.
Parameters :
 newSize The new size (in bytes)






Ensure that there is enough allocated space for X caracters.


 + reserve: void (Size minCapacity);






The content will remain untouched.
Parameters :
 minCapacity The minimum capacity of the string (in bytes)






Resize the string to 'len' bytes.


 + resize: void (const Size len);






The content will remain untouched.
Parameters :
 len The new length (in bytes) of the string






Resize the string to 'len' bytes and fill the new content (if any)



template<class StringT >
 + resize: void (const Size len, const StringT& pattern);






The new content (if any) will be filled with 'pattern'. If the string can not be expanded, the new size will not be greater than the capacity.
  String  s;
  s.resize(6,  '.' );
  std::cout  <<  s  <<  std::endl;  //  '......'
  s.resize(4,  "useless  pattern" );
  std::cout  <<  s  <<  std::endl;  //  '....'
  s.resize(8,  "-a" );
  std::cout  <<  s  <<  std::endl;  //  '....-a-a'

  s  =  "s:  " ;
  s.resize(14,  "\\/" );
  std::cout  <<  s  <<  std::endl;  //  's:  \/\/\/\/\/  ',  note  the  space  at  the  end



Parameters :
 len The new length (in bytes) of the string

 pattern The pattern to use to fill the new content

see :  fill()






Releases any memory not required to store the character data.


 + shrink: void ();






If the string is empty, the internal buffer will be freed. Otherwise the buffer will be reallocated to reduce as much as possible the amount of memory used by the string. It does not modify the size of the string, only its capacity. This method has no effect if the string is not expandable.





Perform a full check about UTF8 validity.


 + utf8valid: bool () const;






This check will iterate through the whole string to detect any bad-formed UTF8 character.





Perform a full check about UTF8 validity.


 + utf8valid: UTF8::Error (Size& offset) const;






This check will iterate through the whole string to detect any bad-formed UTF8 character.
Parameters :
 offset The offset in the string of the misformed UTF8 character

return  UTF8::errNone if the string is valid






Perform a fast check about UTF8 validity.


 + utf8validFast: bool () const;






Contrary to `utf8valid()`, this check is only based on the first code point of an UTF8 sequence. Consequently, it does not perform a full compliance test and you should prefer `utf8valid()`. As a consequence it may report that the string is a valid UTF8 string even if it is not the case, but it may be good enough in some cases.
see :  utf8valid()






Compute the number of UTF-8 characters.


 + utf8size: Size () const;






  String  s  =  "こんにちは" ;
  std::cout  <<  "Size  in  bytes:     "  <<  s.size()  <<  std::endl;  //  15
  std::cout  <<  "Nb  of  UTF8  chars:  "  <<  s.utf8size()  <<  std::endl;  //  5

 The returned value is computed at each call to this routine
return  The number of UTF8 character ( <= size )






Get the current size of the string (in bytes)


 + size: Size () const;






The returned value is less than or equal to the capacity, and greater or equal to the number of UTF8 characters in the string.





 + length: Size () const;







see :  size()






 + sizeInBytes: size_t () const;







see :  size()






the maximum number of characters that the string object can hold (for STL compliance)


 + max_size: size_t () const;






no description




Get if the cstr is empty.


 + empty: bool () const;






  String  s;
  s.empty();           //  returns  true
  s.null();            //  returns  true

  s  =  "hello  world" ;   //  returns  false
  s.empty();           //  returns  false
  s.null();            //  returns  false

  s.clear();
  s.empty();           //  returns  true
  s.null();            //  returns  false

  s.shrink();
  s.empty();           //  returns  true
  s.null();            //  returns  true







Get if the cstr is null.


 + null: bool () const;






A null cstr means that no space is reserved, and that the method `data()` will return NULL.
  String  s;
  s.empty();           //  returns  true
  s.null();            //  returns  true

  s  =  "hello  world" ;   //  returns  false
  s.empty();           //  returns  false
  s.null();            //  returns  false

  s.clear();
  s.empty();           //  returns  true
  s.null();            //  returns  false

  s.shrink();
  s.empty();           //  returns  true
  s.null();            //  returns  true







Get if the string is not empty (the exact opposite of `empty()`)


 + notEmpty: bool () const;

Split a string into several segments.



template<template< class, class>class U, class UType , class Alloc , typename StringT >
 + split: void (U< UType, Alloc>& out, const StringT& sep, bool keepEmptyElements, bool trimElements, bool emptyBefore) const;






Here is an example of how to convert a string to a list of int :  std::list<int>   list;
  String ( "22::80::443::993" ).split(list,  ":" );
  std::cout  <<  list  <<  std::endl;



Parameters :
 out All segments that have been found

 sep Sequence of chars considered as a separator

 keepEmptyElements True to keep empty items

 trimElements Trim each item found

 emptyBefore True to clear the vector before fulfill it

warning :  This method does not take care of string representation (with `'` or `"`)

Extract the key and its value from a string (mainly provided by TDF files or Ini files)



template<class StringT1 , class StringT2 >
 + extractKeyValue: void (StringT1& key, StringT2& value, bool ignoreCase) const;






Simple Ini file structure  [section]
  key  =  value


 More complex :  [section]
  a  =  b;  //  Put  your  comments  here
  b  =
  c  =  ;  //  b  =  c,  empty  values
  return  carriage  =  A  long  string\non  two  lines
  "key"  =  "All  characters  are  allowed  here,  like  semicolons;  :)"

 key The key that has been found

 value The associated value

 ignoreCase True to be case insensitive
